com.netflix.spectator.api

Class Functions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netflix.spectator.api.Functions

  • public final class Functions
extends java.lang.Object
    Common functions for use with gauges.

    • Field Detail

      • IDENTITY

        public static final DoubleFunction<? extends java.lang.Number> IDENTITY

      • AGE

        public static final DoubleFunction<java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong> AGE
        Age function based on the system clock. See age(Clock) for more details.

    • Method Detail

      • age

        public static DoubleFunction<java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong> age(Clock clock)
        Returns a function that computes the age in seconds. The value passed into the function should be a timestamp in milliseconds since the epoch. Typically this will be the return value from calling System.currentTimeMillis().
        Parameters:
        clock - Clock used to get the current time for comparing with the passed in value.
        Returns:
        Function that computes the age.

      • invokeMethod

        public static <T> java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<T> invokeMethod(java.lang.reflect.Method method)
        Returns a function that invokes a method on the object via reflection. If an exception of any kind occurs then NaN will be returned and the exception will be logged. The method must have an empty parameter list and return a primitive number value or a subclass of Number. The method will be set accessible so that private methods can be used.
        Parameters:
        method - Method to execute on the passed in object.
        Returns:
        Value returned by the method or NaN if an exception is thrown.

      • nameEquals

        public static java.util.function.Predicate<Meter> nameEquals(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a predicate that matches if the {code}id.name(){code} value for the input meter is equal to {code}name{code}. Example of usage: 
         long numberOfMatches = registry.stream().filter(Functions.nameEquals("foo")).count();
        Parameters:
        name - The name to use for finding matching meter instances. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        A predicate function that can be used to filter a stream.
